item.title: Release Notes
item.description: Build 1020221207 # Added icons to each screen. Upgraded all dependencies and removed beta and alpha dependency channels. Build 1020221124 # Reverted back to “intest” version to ensure functionality. Build 1020221123 # The app now has an icon. Fixed an issue with the ledger not updating after a large entry is made. Fixed a few issues with the share function. Updated the search interface to be more user-friendly. Build 1020221122 # Database wiped to accommodate schema change (value is now stored as Int as opposed to BigDecimal).

item.title: Technical Details
item.description: Development Environment # IntelliJ IDEA Android Studio # Native Android development necessitates IntelliJ IDEA Android Studio. Programming Language # Kotlin # Kotlin… Is officially preferred by Google as the language for Android over Java. Compiles directly to Java bytecode on Java Virtual Machine to maintain compatibility with legacy platforms. Has Kotlin Multiplaform feature, which enables client-side (JavaScript) and iOS compilation. vs. Java # Kotlin provides many benefits over Java. Below are three most important ones to this developer.

item.title: Future Plans
item.description: Development Improvements # CI/CD # Not having to manually deploy to Google Play Store for every new release would be nice. Code Style Enforcement # At the moment linting is optional. One day I plan to clean up my code and enforce lint rules. One day. Error Handling # At the moment I am certain there are uncaught exceptions. I intend to catch them all. Replace Static Fields with String Resources # I plan to replace static string fields with @StringRes for better testability.
